head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #18

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #18 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy Transport in the port of Michilimakinac in the month of Sept October 1813

Fore part of this day the gale still continues at East with light rain, at 6 AM paid out more cable, at 10 the gale encreases to a violent storm, struck lower & topsail yards down upon deck, at noon rains violently at 3 PM wind chops round to SE with rain hove up the small bower, & shortened in of the best bower, a heavy sea running from the Eastward, ½ past 3 light airs at SW, sent topsail yards up, & lower ones also, at 4 PM wind at WNW & still continues to rain at 7 light airs at NW hove the anchor apeak at 8 set the watch cloudy, dark rainy night the vessel rolls much[.]

Fore part of this day, moderate breezes at South & clear pleasant weather dryed sails latter part wind variable all round the compass, threatening rain at times, Capt Roberts of the Veterans goes for Montreal in a canoe – in company with another – at 8 PM set the watch, a perfect calm, Cloudy & looks for rain[.]

First part of this 24 Hours moderate breezes at WNW & rain, at 10 AM single reefed the topsails & weighed from Makinac – (first calling on the commanding officer for his orders – ) at ½ past noon wind SW & still continues raining blowing a gale, carried away the starboard squar sail boom, the the East end of Bois blanc, at 1 PM wind at SSW blowing fresh course ESE determined on running for St Josephs at 4 PM came too in 5½ fathom water about a mile inside of Frying pan Island, handed sails, hoisted the boat out & sent the men to cut a couple square sail booms & sprits, at 6 wind & weather the same – the vessel makes more water than usual – at 8 PM set the watch[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
